alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Wicomico and Dorchester Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Secretary to 7 miles west of Vienna to 8 miles northwest of Deal Island. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Hurlock, Federalsburg, Sharptown, Secretary, Vienna, East New Market, Mardela Springs, Brookview, Eldorado, Wetipquin, Andrews, Wingate, Elliott, Bucktown, Bivalve and Linkwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland.
